abstract: AMC Entertainment, which owns the second-largest movie theater chain in North America, is in talks to sell itself or a significant stake to the Wanda Group, one of China's largest theater owners. Photo (M)

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES -- AMC Entertainment, which owns the second-largest movie theater chain in North America, is in talks to sell the company or a significant stake in it to the Wanda Group, one of China's largest theater owners, according to people briefed on the discussions. If completed, the deal will begin a new phase in China's push into the global film industry by sharply increasing its leverage with Hollywood and creating the first theater chain to have a commanding presence in the world's two largest movie markets.

headline.main: AMC Said to Be Talking to Chinese Buyer
